avion.detalle: Flying since 1987 and a maximum seating capacity of 180 passengers, it's a short to medium range aircraft, it can cover a distance up to 6.200 km with Sharklets (type of winglet)
Its different variants include A318, A319 and A321. Among the primary users are American Airlines, China Easter Airlines, EasyJet and China Southern Airlines
Flew for the first time in 1967, it's Boeing's primary aircraft for short to medium range flights with a maximum capacity of 200 pax, it can flight up to 7.000 km. depending on the model.
The airlines that use this aircraft the most are Southwest Airlines, Ryanair, United Airlines and American Airlines.

Airbus' response to the Boeing 787, it's the latest aircraft designed by the company: its first flight was in 2013. Covering a distance up to 15.000 km. It has a maximum seating capacity of 400 passengers.
The main airlines flying this type of airplane are Singapore Airlines, Qatar Airways, Cathay Pacific and Lufthansa.
Named the "Dreamliner", it began flying at the end of 2009 covering long distances (around 14.000 km) and taking up to 336 passengers.
All Nippon Airways, Japan Airways, American Airlines and United Airlines are the top 4 customers of the aircraft.

Born in 1991, it was Airbus' main 4-engine aircraft until the King was developed. It can accommodate up to 475 pax and a long distance range of 14.450km. The production of this type of aicraft ended in 2011.
The largest A340 operator is Lufthansa, followed by Iberia, Virgin Atlantic and South African Airways. Around 30 A340 aircrafts fly every day.
Nicknamed the "King of the Skies", it's Airbus' first double-deck aircraft with a typical capacity of 525 pax. The production only lasted 18 years (2003-2021)and it has a range of up to 15.700 km.
Emirates, Singapore Airlines, British Airways and Qantas are the primary users of this aircraft.
Introduced in 1969 as the first partial double-deck jet airliner, the top deck is smaller than the main deck. Flies a distance of 15.000 km and it can take up to 366 people.
The so-called Queen of the Skies is also used for cargo and will end its production in 2022. Atlas Air, Lufthansa, Cargolux and UPS Airlines are the main users.
Another wide-range aircraft from the European company, it began flying in 1992. Its range goes up to 13.450 km. and a maximum of 277 passengers.
Turkish Airlines is the largest operator, followed by Air China, China Eastern Airlines and Delta Airlines.
It's the second biggest from Boeing (after the Queen), and the biggest 2-engine aircraft that began flying in 1994. It flies a distance up to 15.840 km carrying a total of 368 passengers.
Primary users: Emirates, United Airlines, Air France and Cathay Pacific.
Designed as a modification from the Boeing 747, its first flight was in 2006 and it's mainly used for transporting Boeing 787 aircraft components. Only 3 exist.
Airbus' plane used to carry aircraft parts, its name honors the animal it resembles. There're only 5 airplanes of this type that began flying in 1994.
